abstract: After subjecting the biggest U.S. banks to stress tests, regulators ordered 10 to raise more capital and gave the rest clean bills of health.
snippet: After subjecting the biggest U.S. banks to stress tests, regulators ordered 10 to raise more capital and gave the rest clean bills of health.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  After subjecting the nation’s biggest banks to the most public scrutiny in decades, federal regulators ordered 10 of them on Thursday to raise a total of $75 billion in extra capital and gave the rest a clean bill of health.

headline.main: Ailing Banks Need $75 Billion, U.S. Says
headline.print_headline: BANKS TOLD THEY NEED $75 BILLION IN EXTRA CAPITAL

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Bank of New York Mellon Corp
